page.title: 18CARING FOR THE COMMUNITY 1
page.content: For several years local government has been forced to reduce spending on services. This has led to the curtailment of existing services and often the abandonment of planned new ones. At the same time, central government has utilised a portion of the unemployed by creating Community Projects to provide social services to the community on which they are based - albeit on a different level and of a different nature. Taffs Well Community Enterprise Unit sponsor such a scheme in this area. Seventy people who have been unemployed for between 6 and 12 months are given mainly part time jobs for a maximum period of 12 months and paid roughly double the current minimum unemployment benefit. Wages are paid by the government.
